docs.snippet: Facebook isn't just a company. It's a behemoth, with 2.1 billion monthly users, $40 billion in revenue and more than 25,000 employees worldwide.

headline.print_headline: Congress' Challenge: How to Tame Industry Giant Facebook
headline.main: Congress' Challenge: How to Tame Industry Giant Facebook

docs.snippet: The U.S. Justice Department on Monday sought court permission to participate in settlement negotiations aimed at resolving lawsuits by state and local governments against opioid manufacturers and distributors.

headline.print_headline: Justice Department Seeks Role in Opioid Settlement Talks
headline.main: Justice Department Seeks Role in Opioid Settlement Talks

docs.snippet: Eschewing any mention of the corruption scandal that dogged him for years and put his political career in jeopardy, U.S. Sen. Bob Menendez launched his bid for a third term Wednesday, telling a cheering gymnasium full of high school students that ...

headline.print_headline: Bribery Charges Behind Him, Menendez Runs for Re-election
headline.main: Bribery Charges Behind Him, Menendez Runs for Re-election

docs.snippet: A committee of British lawmakers published written evidence on Thursday provided by a whistleblower who says information about 50 million Facebook users ended up in the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

headline.print_headline: UK Lawmakers Publish Evidence From Cambridge Analytica Whistleblower
headline.main: UK Lawmakers Publish Evidence From Cambridge Analytica Whistleblower

docs.snippet: Caroline Beresford, the No. 2 diplomat in New Zealand’s embassy in Washington, said Democrats needed to elect winning candidates or “we will all die.”

headline.print_headline: New Zealand Diplomat Censured for Vulgar Tweet About U.S. Democrats
headline.main: New Zealand Diplomat Censured for Vulgar Tweet About U.S. Democrats

docs.snippet: United Nations chief Antonio Guterres warned on Thursday that Russian and U.S. relations were deteriorating into a situation "similar, to a large extent, to what we lived during the Cold War" and called for safeguards to be put in place.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Chief Warns Another Cold War Developing Between Russia, U.S.
headline.main: U.N. Chief Warns Another Cold War Developing Between Russia, U.S.

docs.snippet: The United States and South Korea have agreed to revise a trade pact with a side deal to deter competitive currency devaluation by Seoul and with concessions for U.S. autos and pharmaceutical companies, Trump administration officials said on Tuesd...

headline.print_headline: In South Korea, U.S. Cars Are Rare, and Often German or Japanese
headline.main: In South Korea, U.S. Cars Are Rare, and Often German or Japanese

docs.snippet: A U.S. and a British service member in the U.S.-led coalition battling Islamic State were killed by an improvised explosive device in Syria, U.S and British officials said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: U.S., British Service Members Killed by Improvised Bomb in Syria
headline.main: U.S., British Service Members Killed by Improvised Bomb in Syria
